caption:
This photograph depicts a scenic garden setting and features a group of children on an outing. In the foreground, a wooden sign reading "Garden for the Blind" is prominently displayed, positioned in front of a well-maintained flower bed with yellow and green foliage. A concrete planter with plants also appears beside the sign.

Towards the middle of the image, a group of children, approximately 7 to 10 years old, can be seen walking and standing along a path. They are dressed in typical casual attire from what appears to be the late 20th century (jeans, sweaters, and vests). The children are variously engaged; some are walking towards the camera, while others stand and appear to be waiting or talking.

In the background, thereâ€™s a small wooden structure labeled "Visitors Center" and beneath in a smaller sign, "Snack Shop". This building is surrounded by dense trees which suggest the setting is in a moderately forested area, possibly part of a larger park or botanical garden designated for educational visits like this one.

The overall ambiance of the photograph is lively and educational, mixing elements of nature exploration with a structured learning environment. The emphasis appears to be on sensory garden experience tailored for all visitors, including those with visual impairments, as suggested by the foreground sign.
title: High Rock Park, in Staten Island, has nature trails, wildlife preserves, and a garden for the blind. School children are frequent visitors. The group shown here is from PS 163, New York City.
